intro: Echinocereus caespitosus, commonly known as the cactus pear or prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense clusters of spiny, cylindrical stems that are often covered in a whitish bloom. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers during the spring and summer months, which are followed by edible, red-fleshed fruits. Its stems are used for ornamental purposes and in some traditional medicines. The plant is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local wildlife.
